text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 2.8.2, Audit Information Management System (AIMS), AIMS Command Code AM424.
CIC-LCC-CD is a new optional input ﬁeld for AM424, Line 1 position 65.
) CIC-LCC-CD is a new optional input ﬁeld for AM
) New error message: “CIC-LCC-CD ONLY VALID FOR EGC

This IRM is intended for the general use of IDRS system personnel from all four Business Operating Divisions (W&I, SB/SE, LB&I and TE/GE) and Appeals accessing the Audit Information Management System.
) This IRM section provides the instructions for the Audit Information Manage- ment System (AIMS) command code AM
is used to establish a Master ﬁle tax module on the AIMS Data base. AM
(FA) record to Employee Plans Master File (EPMF), Individual Master File (IMF) and Business Master File (BMF) when a tax module is established on AIMS. AM
-DELETE-RECORD (F#) record to End of Day (EOD) processing if the AM
that established the Masterﬁle Tax Module and the AM
D are done on the same day. AM
) record to IMF, BMF and EPMF when AM
D is used to delete a Master File tax module from AIMS when the AM
to establish the tax module is not done on the same day. AM
) record to IMF or BMF to indicate that examination activity has occurred on a tax module that has not been established on AIMS.
List of terms and deﬁnitions used throughout this IRM Section
Acronyms Deﬁnitions PBC Primary Business Code IMF Individual Master File BMF Business Master File EPMF Employee Plans Master File TIN Taxpayer Identiﬁcation Number
) Tax Return records for AIMS may be automatically selected through “DIF (Dis- criminate Function)” and “Unallowable” programs, or may be requested from masterﬁle via an AIMS realtime terminal. (
is used to request records for AIMS from IMF (Indi- vidual Master File), BMF (Business Master File), or EPMF (Employee Plans Master File). NMF records are established with Command Code AMNON. (

is generated to the appropriate master-ﬁle, and an open AIMS record is established on AIMS under the speciﬁc TIN (Taxpayer Identiﬁcation Number), File Source, MFT (Master File Tax Account Code), and Tax Period (also, Plan Number if the MFT is
or Plan Report Number if the MFT is
request is sent to master-ﬁle for a “ full” Tax Return record. If or when a TC
posts to Master File, a “full” record is sent back to AIMS along with a Return Charge-Out document and labels to be generated if requested. Upon receipt of the full record, AIMS sends a TC
back to Master File when it replaces the original
a. An exception to the above chain of events occurs when Source Code
are input with a valid push code by CC AM
; in this case, there is no TC
An exception to the above chain of events occurs when Source Code
are input with a valid push code by CC AM
; in this case, there is no TC
generated to master- ﬁle and no Return Charge-Out document or labels are generated. If CC
AM424 is re-input for the same tax module with a different source or EGC, the TC424 will be generated at that time.
Input documents for CC AM424 are:
) There are two types of error messages that can be generated as a result of the input of CC AM

a. The ﬁrst type results from mistakes made on the input of data or from input of data that does not match data at the NAP (National Account Proﬁle). b. The second type will occur when the data was entered correctly but the TIN, F/S (File Source), MFT and Tax Period (also, Plan Number if the MFT is
or Plan Report Number if the MFT is
) entered match a Tax Module already on the AIMS data base. (
) Mistakes made on the input of data: Individual entries are processed one a time. When an error is encountered, the entire screen will be displayed back and instead of the literal “OK ” in positions
of the error line, asterisks (**) will be displayed. Line entries which follow the ﬁrst erroneous entry will not be processed and positions

on these lines will be left blank when displayed back. a. When the input screen has been displayed back, the terminal operator may correct the invalid line entry and re-transmit the screen. b. If the operator wants to drop an invalid entry, the operator overlays the two asterisks with “DR” and retransmits the screen (Unless it is the last entry, in which case no action is necessary). Entry lines transmitted with “OK” in positions
will be returned with “BY” (by-pass) in positions

Following are the error messages for Command Code AM424:
4TH DIGIT OF CASE GRADE MUST BE BLANK OR R
Account exists on reverse side of VALIDITY AIMS database
Self explanatory. For EGCs 77XX and 79XX only.
, Plan/Report Number must be For AC
, Examination Division Reporting System Codes Booklet, Document
Exempt Organizations Man- agement Information Systems Codes, Document
Govern- ment Entities Computer Systems Codes.
ACTIVITY CODE XXX IS NON-TAXABLE - CLAIM AMOUNT INVALID
ACTIVITY CODE 495 NOT VALID FOR RETURNS WITH A TAX PERIOD AFTER 200712
For MFT 05, ACT-CD 495 is not valid for Tax Periods after 200712.
AGING-REASON-CD 50 & 51 ARE ONLY VALID WITH PBC 212
CIC-LCC-CD ONLY VALID FOR EGC 1XXX, 54XX OR 58XX
EGC 1998 & 2998 ARE NOT VALID WITH STATUS 5X
For EGCs 1000 and 2000 and input is at a district office terminal, the Source Code must be 60.
EPMF ACCOUNT-ACT-CD MUST BE 307 OR 312 OR 315
F1 RECORD PRESENT - INPUT PBC, SBC, EGC AND STATUS CODE MUST MATCH DATA BASE
Screen PBC, SBC, EGC and Status Code must match the PBC, SBC, EGC and Status Code on the AIMS Data Base.
FIRST 2 DIGITS OF THE TAX PERIOD MUST BE 19 OR 20
The century digits of the Tax Period must be in the ﬁrst two characters of the Tax Period and must be either 19 or 20.
IF TIN CORRECT, NAME CONTROL IS VVVV.
PBC 1XX and 2XX must equal 1XXX or 2XXX. PBC 3XX must equal 1XXX, except PBC 330 - valid with 2XXX.
Input PBC not consistent with Service Center.
First digit of Employee Group Code must be 1, 2 or 5.
For WI, SB and LB&I: Last 2 digits of the PRIMARY- BUSINESS-CD must be 00-07, 12-14, 20, 21, 23-27, 30, 90- 99.
Does not meet standard validity criteria.
First 3 digits of the SECONDARY-BUSINESS-CD must be 000-947, 949, 950, 951, 960,970, 980.
INVALID SOURCE CODE FOR EP ACCOUNT
Not numeric, or not valid on AIMS. Valid values are 00, 01, 04-13, 15-20, 22-39, 51-57, 59 or 60. If record input at a district office terminal, Status Code can not equal 01. Blanks invalid.
4th and 5th positions of the SECONDARY-BUSINESS-CD must be 00-60.
TIN does not have valid conﬁguration and File Source indicator.
LAP access problem. Try again. NAP error message.
All line entries were bypassed because of DR and/or OK in positions 41 and 42.
MFT 29 ONLY VALID FOR TAX PERIODS 200012 AND SUBSE- QUENT
NAME LINE YEAR AT MF IS LATER THAN TAX PERIOD INPUT (AM424 REJECT CODE 1880)
Input tax period is prior to master ﬁle name line year. NAP error message.
NATIONAL ENTITY FILE NOT AVAILABLE - TRY LATER
NO TC 150 PRESENT AT MF (AM424 REJECT CODE 1735)
PBC 2XX, 330 - EGC 1998 & 2998 NOT VALID - MUST UPDATE TO ANOTHER EGC
PBC 320, 321, 323-327, 330 SOURCE CODE 20 NOT ALLOWED FOR OPENINGS
PBC 398 IS ONLY VALID WITH EGC 54XX/57XX/58XX
PBC 3XX REQUIRES AGING-REASON-CD FOR STATUS-CD 15 OPENINGS
PLAN NUMBER INPUT IS NOT ESTABLISHED ON THE EPMF
General error message for AM424A. An asterisk appears to the right of invalid ﬁeld.
PUSH CODE 021 OR 036 ONLY VALID WITH SOURCE CODE 43
For EGC 7XXX, Push Code 021 or 036 only valid with Source Code 43.
PUSH CODE 037 - REQUIRES SPECIAL PROJECT CD 0149
PUSH CODE 051 ONLY VALID WITH SOURCE-CD 31
PUSH CODE 072 ONLY VALID WITH MFT 46
PUSH CODE XXX, STATUTE EE REQUIRED
Statute Day EE is required for Push Code XXX. Exception MFT 46, 84, 85, 86.
For MFT 29 only PUSH-CD 020-025, 037, 041, 049, 081 are valid.
Standard reply for successful update, and number of updates.
RETURN REQUEST INDICATOR NOT 1, 3 OR BLANK
SECONDARY BUSINESS CD MUST BE NUMERIC
For EGC 7XXX: May be input. If input, must be numeric.
SOURCE CODE 20 NOT VALID WITH EGC 1100-1849 AND 2100- 2849 FOR OPENINGS
If the EGC is 1000 or 2000, and the Push Code is 024-036, 038-040 the Source Code must be 60.
SPECIAL PROJECT CODE XXXX IS NOT VALID AFTER 199012
STATUS 51-59 NOT ALLOWED WITH PBC XXX FOR AM424
(Where XXX equals SCREEN PBC) Not allowed with PBC 201-207, 212-214, 320, 321, 323-327 or 330.
STATUS CODE 07 IS COMPUTER GENERATED - CANNOT ESTABLISH CASE WITH STATUS 07
For Exam, Status Code 07 is invalid if terminal is not a Service Center terminal.
ARE NOT VALID WITH SOURCE CODE
Must be alphabetic AA thru ZZ- 7XXX. Must be alphabetic AA- WW, YY, ZZ, 1XXX, 2XXX,5XXX.
TAX MODULE NOT FOUND ON NAP, PUSH CODE REQUIRED
TC 150 PRESENT AT MF- NO PUSH-CD REQUIRED
Push Code input is not 010, 019, 049 or 121 and Tax Period at Master File matches screen Tax Period and TC-150 has posted at Master File.
TEFRA-CD required for MFT 06 if EGC = 1XXX or 2XXX and STATUS-CD = 13 thru 19.
TEGE-OPEN-CASE-GRADE ONLY VALID WITH EGC 76XX, 7XXX OR 79XX
TEGE-OPEN-CASE-GRADE MUST BE 09 OR 11-14 FOR EGC 76XX
TERMINAL SERVICE CENTER CD NOT EQUAL TO AIMS DATA BASE SERVICE CENTER CD
Account on AIMS is changed-TIN case. v-v displays new TIN, F/S, and Check Digit or Name Control.
AIMS area not available. (XXXXXX = database area which is down.)

of input. b. If a ﬁeld is found to be in error, that ﬁeld will be followed by an asterisk and the following error message will appear on line

Disposal code is used to update Master File. AM424D only generates a 421 transaction to MF for cases input more than 15 days prior to the current date.
DISPOSAL-CD IS A VALID INPUT ONLY WHEN PUSH-CD 020, 021, 037, 039, OR 041 IS PRESENT
Disposal code is used to update Master File. AM424D only generates a 421 transaction to MF for cases input with one of the listed push codes
Record is not at a service center terminal and can not be deleted.
Value other than 36 thru 41 entered in positions 26-27.
AM424D attempted to delete a Tax Module that was not a 424 Tax Module.
You must delete the record on the same day the case was created or you must wait 30 days from the Opening-Creation date before deleting the record.

3 Batch Input of AM424 (Same EIN, different tax periods)
NOTE: Literal “ R” in ﬁrst position of the 3rd line and lines following indicates that the TIN/FILE Source is the same as on the preceding line.

NOTE: When Name Control is input the computer will compare and search for a similar record on AIMS for the same taxpayer. If the two NAME Control ﬁelds do not match, a message is dis- played:“IF TIN CORRECT, NAME CONTROL IS VVVV”. The terminal operator may then change the input Name Control to the one displayed in the message, and re-transmit the screen; or if the operator is sure that the current input Name Control is correct, the operator enters “ AA” in positions 79-80 of the entry line, re-transmits the screen, and the computer will “bypass ” this Name Control check. As many as 11 tax periods for a single taxpayer may be input on one screen (Line 24 is reserved for operational messages). After input of CC AM424 with one taxpayer and multiple tax periods, if no errors are encountered, the entire screen will be displayed back, and the literal “OK” will appear in positions 79-80, lines 2-12, and the message “REQUEST COMPLETED” on line 24.

3 Batch Input of AM424, different TINs
Each line beginning with line 2 is to be considered as an individual entry with as many as 11 entries on a single input screen (lines 2-12).

Individual entries beginning with line 2 will be processed one at a time until 11 entries on the screen have been processed. When all the entries on the screen have been processed, the entire screen will be displayed back and if no errors are encountered, the literal “OK” will be displayed in positions 79 and 80 after each successful entry. The message: “ REQUEST COMPLETED/UPDATES nnnn ” will be displayed on line 24. Exhibit 2.8.2-6. Command Code AM424.

CC AM424 input with Source Code 60
A source Code of “60” input with EGC 1000/2000 does not follow the standard AM424 processing. It will:

If at a later date CC AM424 is input with other than Source Code 60 or EGC 1000 or 2000, and it matches a 424 base on AIMS with a Source Code 60 and EGC 1000 or 2000, then the CC AM424 input will process normally but a special “ Information Report Indicator” will be generated for print on the Form 5546.

This command code is similar to CC AM424; however, it is limited to establishing AIMS bases for appeals offices. CC AM424A is different from CC AM424 as follows:
Single input is the only entry mode accepted.

b. It must be entered. 8 2 79-80 Validity Indicator
Appeals Code - 3 digit numeric (Item 7 on Form 5571). It must be entered.

(1) This Command Code, with modiﬁer “D”, is used to delete AIMS 424 bases that were established incorrectly. a. For Cases with EGC 5xxx the terminal must be designated as a Service Center. b. Records can only be deleted by AM424D if: 1. The creation date is the same as the current date. Only 1000 cases of this type can be deleted per Service Center per day. or 2. Creation date is at least 15 days prior to the current date (2) Input Display of AM424D a. Screen Display
This Command Code, with modiﬁer “D”, is used to delete AIMS 424 bases that were established incorrectly.
For Cases with EGC 5xxx the terminal must be designated as a Service Center.
The creation date is the same as the current date. Only 1000 cases of this type can be deleted per Service Center per day.
Creation date is at least 15 days prior to the current date

ELEMENT LINE POSITION DESCRIPTION 1 1 1-6 Command Code and Modiﬁer 2 1 15-16 MFT Code 3 2 1-12 TIN and File Source 4 2 14-17 Name Control/Check Digits (vvvv or bbaa) 5 2-12 19-24 Tax Period (YYYYMM format) 6 2-12 26-27 Disposal Code * 7 3-12 1 R *

* The literal “R” in position 1 lines 3-12 indicates that the TIN/File Source and the Name Control/ Check Digit are the same as on the preceding line. System will not repeat Disposal Code, must be input on each line as needed.
This Command Code, with Modiﬁer “Z”, is used to zero out a counter. It performs no other function.

For each terminal, there is a 4-character “AM424 Update Counter”, used to keep track of AM424 updates. The counter is incremented by one for each successful update of AM424, AM424A, AM424D, AM424R, and AM424E.
The total number of updates is displayed along with the Request Completed message in the following format: “REQUEST COMPLETED/UPDATES nnnn. ”
Whenever you wish to reset the counter to zero, enter AM424Z in positions 1–6 of line 1, and transmit the screen. The message: “ COMPLETED/UPDATES 0000” is returned.
This Command Code, with modiﬁer “M”, is used to generate a TC 421 Transaction Record without establishing a record on AIMS. It is valid for IMF and BMF only.
